website_summaries.verdict: A BPA-free dry food feeder that creates healthy and stimulating feline lifestyle.
pros: With a heavy base, this feeder is engineered to create a timed eating experience that works especially for those cats that wolf down food
Features plastic spikes that look like grass
Customers appreciate that it's easy to clean
Works for cats of all ages and conditions
cons: While some cats may lose weight, it's not designed for weight loss

website_summaries.verdict: Despite making mealtimes more challenging, most cats actually seem to enjoy using this bowl. If you have a stubborn kitty, this option is worth a try.
pros: Protrusions force cats to reach into the bowl and lift food out, putting an end to gulping
Low sides allow unmotivated kitties to push bits of food out
Appeals to natural feline hunting instincts
cons: Large pawed cats might have a tough time reaching food near the center of the bowl

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat scarfs down her whole bowl of food so fast she ends up barfing up undigested food. Definitely gross, and probably a story you have heard before. This was recommended to us by an animal behaviorist who suggested it would also help give her some mental stimulation. It's a lot bigger than I expected from the photos but not so huge it gets in the way. Packaging is recyclable which is great, no unnecessary plastic wraps or anything like that. We put some treats in to get her acquainted with the feeder and catch her interest and then we moved on to food. She figured out how to maneuver it quickly, and it has already slowed her down considerably.
customer_reviews.author: Kells

customer_reviews.title: I am happy I found this product
customer_reviews.text: It took my cat three days to get used to it. But look at three months before and now, from 22lbs to 19lbs. I am happy I found this product, it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mealtime enrichment!
customer_reviews.text: My cat tends to eat so quickly that she vomits. This feeder is perfect! She was a bit confused the first time, but she figured it out. She has to paw the food out from between the "fingers" and it definitely slows her down. It's fun to watch her, too. The feeder is heavy so she can't flip it over. I should have gotten this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: J. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great stimulation and entertainment for blind cat
customer_reviews.text: I have a blind cat and I am always looking for new forms of entertainment and stimulation for her. This feeder has been a great solution for her as it allows her to use her sense of smell and her paws to find the food and catch it out of the feeder. This is much more interactive than just eating out of a dish, so it keeps her occupied throughout the day and by 'grazing' on her meal over several hours rather than a couple of minutes she eats in a more natural way and doesn't beg for meal times. Very well made and easy to clean. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mlive

customer_reviews.title: Fat Cat disapproves, we love!
customer_reviews.text: Before product, fat cat ate all his breakfast/dinner in a matter of a few minutes. Now fat cat is forced to work for his meal. It takes him awhile and he has to take breaks but he eventually gets all the food. He will vocally tell us if his annoyance with he product but we just tell him to get over it. We are sure he will loose weight now :)
customer_reviews.author: Destinee

customer_reviews.title: This thing is massive
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting this to be as big as it is, looks like it's for a dog. But either way, it does its job of forcing my little chunkers to work for his treats. It's a good item, only 4 stars cause its a big eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory And Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I have a fat black cat that needs to go on a diet, so I purchased this feeder. I don't quite understand all the positive reviews. The feeder is made of HARD plastic, with no give to it. The spikey things are so tall that my cat can't reach the food. He couldn't even get his paw to fit in-between the spikes. If the spikey things were shorter I could understand the appeal. I had to return this feeder, and I wouldn't recommend it to cat owners.
customer_reviews.author: KySoph

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure in theory this is a great dish to slow fast eaters. However, my big boy flipped the bowl over everytime and ate the food. Maybe it's time to replace the cat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems to enjoy it, but today I found two scratches on his face, including one very close to his eye. It's a dangerous toy and I highly advise nobody purchase it as it could lead to serious injury. A shame, as it's otherwise a very good idea, but the points are not blunt enough to prevent injury.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser4Evrrr

customer_reviews.title: Great for kibble, but not for wet foods.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it doesn't work for us anymore. We had to switch to wet food and this works better with dry kibble. Our cat used her paws with dry kibble but with wet food she couldn't get to it because the prongs were too long and using her paw made a total mess. We're still looking for an answer to slow her feeding down so she can keep it down. May try a licky mat or just one with smaller prongs so she can get to the food. I will say it is very well made and did work well with dry food. If your pet is on dry food, this could work.
customer_reviews.author: Renee' M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this dish, Yep a Dog. I got this one as it looked a little harder then the dog one for my smart and extremely fast eating Sheltie Chow mix. She loves eating from this dish and it slows her down a lot since she has to use her tongue to get the food out of the dish. She seems to enjoy eating from the dish and she doesn't throw up her food later or have bad gas anymore. Works great and can hold up to 2 cups of dog food in it so it is a good size.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pearce

customer_reviews.title: No more binge eating!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat will eat everything that's put into her bowl as soon as it's put out. Now she gets a little bit of food in the bowl and the majority in the feeder. As soon as she empties the bowl she races right to the feeder/puzzle to work for the rest of her meal. It took her about 10 minutes to figure out her face doesn't fit into the feeder and now she really seems to enjoy working for her food. My only minor complaint is that as she paws at the food the feeder slides around the floor a bit but it's not a big deal. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Too TALL for my CATS 🐈
customer_reviews.text: This product is too tall to work for my cats. It's a great idea for a slower feeder. None of my 4 cats could get the food. Found one shorter that is working well. FYI: All 4 of my cats have tried many different types of activity feeders some which have worked out well; just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: DocBeiter

customer_reviews.title: Purr purr perfect 👌🏼
customer_reviews.text: So my cat scarfs down food like he has been starving or some thing is going to take it away or eat it all on him. Then he ends up throwing up later because he ate so fast. So I did some looking and found this product and it's been recommended by animal behaviorists (stated by the pet owners in the comments on here and how it's been effective for them). So I decided to give it a whirl. It took my cat 4minutes to figure out how to get one kibble and has been purring the whole time while going in circles trying to figure out the concept. 👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hut

customer_reviews.title: I think it is great but I wish it were heavier since while the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for two days now but both cats have figured it out and are using it. I think it is great but I wish it were heavier since while the cats are pawing at the food, the feeder moves on the tile floor. I tried to put it on a rug but they were still able to move it. I might try some anti-slip stoppers on the bottom to see if that helps at all. Overall, great product! P.S. Sorry the video is sideways. :)
customer_reviews.author: wondersunny78

customer_reviews.title: Worked well enough
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats who love to eat and we use this to slow down their eating. We feed twice a day, and then leave two tablespoons overnight and they still most days have some left that either they could not reach or we filled up and just left. We cannot leave if for them during the day, but it is great for overnight. We used to leave two bowls for them overnight and that was bad, especially for one of them who eats until he can't anymore because he is stuffed. This slows him down and both eat properly overnight.
customer_reviews.author: JQ2intx

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats that eat too fast or cats that love to hunt
customer_reviews.text: We had one cat that would eat way to fast and had a weight issue. This helped with both of those issues. Getting him to eat a little slower helped him eat a little bit less throughout the day. Our new cat is far too smart for her own good; this feeder keeps her mind occupied while she gets to hunt for food. We had to remove the feeder for a couple days and she seemed very sad about it. It's now back and all is right with her world.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Farris

customer_reviews.title: My cats are jerks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because one of my cats is a giant fatso and it has slowed him down. He has to pull the food out with his paws as designed. However, my other cat who isn't an over eater is too stupid and timid to put his paws in there a pull the food out. He just sits there looking at it and allows himself to go hungry until I eventually do the work for him. As every cat owner knows - CATS ARE JERKS!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: No more scarf and barf!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fabulous! I got it because my cat eats too much too quick, but gets anxious when food is not available. It did take several days for her to figure it out (I almost broke and gave her a bowl), but she finally used it after many nights of me trying to teach her how. She barfed the night she mastered it, but not one since! Woo hoo!
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: My fat heifer cat was horking down his food like a starved wildebeest every time I fed him. Inevitably he's end up barfing up his food from not stopping long enough to chew or breathe I guess. This device has slowed him down considerably since he has to work his greedy little paw around in the grooves to get a tasty morsel out. I'm happy with how he's eating now. Less barf to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Granados

customer_reviews.title: My cat that gobbles hates this...too bad for her
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that gobbles, then throws up. I hate cleaning that up all the time. I happened on this product and thought I would try it. It works! No more throw up. She did not eat out of it for two whole days. On the third day she gave up and ate out of it. Glad I waited her out. No more throw up. Yay! Very happy cat owner, but I'm not sure the cat would agree about how great this is.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine M

customer_reviews.title: Our voracious Bengal uses this several times a day
customer_reviews.text: This was even more useful than I'd hoped. Our cat asks for food less often because he has this to play with to get his food. He seems downright proud of himself for getting his dry food out piece by piece, enjoying the puzzle and the food. Sometimes he manages to pick up a piece in his upside-down paw instead of pulling it to the floor :-)
customer_reviews.author: Diego Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Slowed My Cat Down, No More Begging!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has worked well with my cat. Initially, he was super mad that he had to eat out of it, but over the course of a couple weeks he's adjusted and figured it out. It definitely slows him down and makes eating hard enough work that he doesn't make the effort unless he really wants the food. This has generally ended his 0430 yowling routine, and he's never rushing to devour his food when I put it out. My only comment is that the dish itself is pretty big. It works so I'm not complaining, but it also takes up a fair amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My oldest cat had a habit of vomiting nearly after ...
customer_reviews.text: My oldest cat had a habit of vomiting nearly after every meal. I tried feeding her, and the other cat, less food to see if that would help and it didn't. It actually made them both more demanding. So I thought this might help with the vomiting and constantly begging for food and it did! The cats figured out how to get their food fairly quickly and never had trouble with it. The only thing is that when they try to get food from the middle of it, they end up pushing the feeder around in the kitchen since it's tile. But that's a small detail and they don't push it around too far. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for feeding either dry or wet food.
customer_reviews.text: As long as I distribute the dry food wide enough apart, which is not hard to do, my cat does not eat the food too fast. If I use this to feed her canned food it is very easy to clean between feedings. I still tend to feed her dry food in this feeder. She does fine with it
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It definitely helped slow down my cats eating, but ...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely helped slow down my cats eating, but unfortunately the plastic it's made of harbors bacteria. My male cat developed some blackheads on his chin which became angry, red, pus-filled sores. He had to be at the vet for a week as they cleaned the area of pus and gave him antibiotics. Even with cleaning the feeder regularly this happened. If you decide to use it please be diligent about monitoring your cat's chin area as this is where the acne is likely to form.
customer_reviews.author: ACM

customer_reviews.title: Great to curb over eating and to slow down fast eaters!
customer_reviews.text: This food bowl is amazing! My cat is overweight and scarfs down her food in the first 5 minutes after I put food into her normal bowl. Now she eats less and more periodically throughout the day! Since we started using this interactive feeder she has visibly lost weight, looks healthier, and seems to have much more energy than before. She was able to figure out how to get the food out of the bowl within the first 5 minutes without issue. She did try to avoid using the bowl for the first few days, but after about 2 days she gave up and has been using the bowl without complaint. Wish I’d known about this earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work for my cat, too hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: After the first use I immediately knew that it wasn't going to work. The "prongs" are stiff and have no give, and my poor cat could NOT get the food out unless I manually pushed it all out to the very edge. He couldn't fit his paws between the prongs very easily either. This item has been replaced with "Pioneer Pet Tiger Diner Ceramic Food Dish/Bowl, Black", and we LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Felts

customer_reviews.title: Slows down my cats' eating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to slow down our cats' eating. What used to take about 1 minute for the cats to eat now takes about 10 minutes. The cats have to use their paws to flick the kibble out of the bowl. My husband and I are veterinarians and now we recommend this to our clients with cats who eat too fast and then vomit up the food.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Updike

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fat Cat
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's cat has gained a lot of weight from lack of exercise and gorging his food. This feeder definitely slowed his intake and amount of food eaten throughout the day. He seems to like finding the kibbles so the exerted energy should help with his weight problem too. As others commented, it was funny to watch his initial reaction and whining over the first two days. However, he's accepted the feeder and is learning to change his eating habits. Note: I attached adhesive velcro (hook side) to the bottom of the feeder to prevent it from moving around on the carpet. I suppose you could put the loop side on the floor if that's what you are dealing with.
customer_reviews.author: Sappuri

customer_reviews.title: No more chow hound (or cat)
customer_reviews.text: This the perfect solution if you have a cat who inhales his food then starts begging for more. He has really slowed down with his eating meaning that he no longer upchucks his food. We are just so pleased with this purchase! I highly recommend it. (The only slight change I would make would be to put some kind of rubber feet on it. Since he has to drag the food out of it with his paw, he tends to scooch the feeder all over the room.)
customer_reviews.author: MediaMom411

customer_reviews.title: Nice Activity
customer_reviews.text: My cat will practically inhale his treats but this slows him down. I like that it provides a bit of a challenge and some activity for him.
customer_reviews.author: DecFlower CA

customer_reviews.title: My older cat was very frustrated with this, he ...
customer_reviews.text: My older cat was very frustrated with this, he could not get to any food. I ended up using a muffin tin, (wish I had found this tip earlier) and the binging and barfing stopped.
customer_reviews.author: leslie D

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Did the job slowing my cat down while eating, which means no more puking after eating which has been nice. I wish it wouldn't slide around as he ate though--the few rubber grips on the bottom do little to nothing to hold it in place. Cleaning is easy as I throw it in the dishwasher once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Eiram

customer_reviews.title: Ends up with me foraging more than my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat refuses to use this. I am foraging for the food for her and then she eats it off the floor. I am not giving up just yet though. Going on vacation tomorrow and leaving some food in there to see if maybe when she's desperate she will actually try. Will report back.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Slims down a fat cat.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Bengal cat that loves to eat. He inhales food and immediately demands more food. In an effort to control his weight and encourage him to let me sleep at night, I bought this interactive cat feeder. He is very good at getting food from this feeder, however I think that his stomach stretch receptors have more time to kick in (or he just gets lazy after a few bites) and no longer eats everything at once. I can sleep through the night, and he is on a much healthier "rate of eating" now. The only downside is that the food I use in this cat feeder is dry food.
customer_reviews.author: hyacinth2007

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to keep my cat from gorging and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my cat from gorging and vomiting. My cat is almost a year old and I thought she would outgrow it and still hasn't, so this seemed to be a solution. It works well, the only problem is that it is too lightweight and ends up all over the house as my cat pushes it around. Some of the other reviews state that the prongs aren't spaced far enough apart for large cats.... my cat is a full bred Mainecoon and she is able to get her paws in and get the food out. I give it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: One cat loves it one doesn't care
customer_reviews.text: One cat loves it the other can't be bothered with it. One cat will pick regular dry food out of it even though there is a bowl of the same food two feet away. She's become very quick at getting the pieces she wants. I think it's time for something more complicated. Our second cat won't even try it, smell it or look at it. She also doesn't try to open doors either. She sits patiently waiting for someone to come by and do it for her. I would try this toy/feeder with a cat that is always looking for something to get into, the trash, cabinets, closets.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Berg

customer_reviews.title: Silly looking but great idea, and IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: At first they wanted nothing to do with it but my kitties have accepted it now and freely use it. I do think it keeps them from gorging on food, and over eating. A sidenote bonus: no kitty has puked since using this food bowl. My two big kitties were notorious for puking because they ate too much, too fast. I give this dish FIVE stars, although I'm pretty sure the cats are still annoyed but they're also hungry so they're getting used to it. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Julie G

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty lightweight, so our two young cats move it around quite a bit. I had purchased it to catch food from an automatic feeder to slow down the eating. However, even with a non-skid pad underneath, the cats push it around enough that it needs to be repositioned before the next feeding. (Not very useful when we are out of town.) My cats also struggle a little more negotiating the large points, but they probably just need to get used to those. Overall, I much prefer the Trixie 5-in-1 Activity Center.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Polydactyl Cats May Get Frustrated - Otherwise, Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: My female cat Ducky loves this puzzle feeder. She took to it right away once I showed her there were yummy treats hiding among the pillars. My male cat Petrie gets a little bit frustrated with this thing because he is a polydactyl - those extra thumbs don't exactly make this activity easier! So after a few attempts at the ones that make their way to the perimeter, he will lie down and watch Ducky fish them out, soliciting for fallout. I've noticed a positive change in my animal friends with the added mental stimulation (along with regular interactive playtime.) I would definitely recommend this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Dovahkiina

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: I have a chonky cat who eats very fast and throws up and I was hoping this would slow him down. Sadly this did not happen. I fed him in the bowl 4 or 5 times and he threw up even more. I washed the bowl very well, and he still threw up after his feeding. His throwing up got worse, and when we switched back to his old bowl he was fine. We could not use it.
customer_reviews.author: LilaMendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bowl as well
customer_reviews.text: I love this bowl for my medium mix breed dog. I have went through two other slow feeding bowls, but she still was able to mow through too fast. The “spikes” are large so it slows her down a lot. Also, I think it might be giving her a teeth brushing effect as well. Down side, is I think it needs to have a higher edge for more food. They advise it as a cat bowl, but it is pretty big and could fit easily a couple cups of food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat ignored it, but it's a good product
customer_reviews.text: My cat might just be stupid, but she did not want to eat from the Northmate Catch Interactive Feeder. Here are my initial impressions: PROS: - Easy to clean (just rinse and let air dry) - Mentally stimulates your cat and promotes natural eating habits CONS: - Expensive - My cat wasn't interested If your cat will use the feeder, I think this product is a great way to feed your cat. It will reduce boredom, increase activity, and maybe even help chubby kitties lose weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile for the cat to get used to it. He was sort of 'hunger striking' but eventually started eating from the feeder. Slowly at first and it took him awhile to figure out how to get the food from the middle where the spikes are the tallest. But trust me, they eventually learn. Now he is quite quick at getting the food when he wants it. It does slow him down from feeding him in a bowl and he doesn't get sick as much. Worth waiting out his hunger strike and learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Tacitus86

customer_reviews.title: Weirdlooking but it Helps the Puke Issue in our Household
customer_reviews.text: My Fat Puking Cat (who I love dearly) is still fat, but pukes less because she cannot hog down her food. It took three-four days of howling and soulful looks before she broke down and started to use her (rather limited) brainpower to problem solve how to get to the food, but now she purrs as she paws out the kibbles and is over it. I have wood floors so the thing moves along as the cat paws out the food, you might want to put the thing on a mat or rug of some sort, I am still thinking that one through as there is usually kibble crumbs on the floor. Could this be why I'm single? Hmmm.....
customer_reviews.author: Cool Kelly

customer_reviews.title: so this makes me happy. I'm so happy I found this product because ...
customer_reviews.text: It works! After a month my overweight cat is already looking slightly slimmer and I find myself measuring out less food than before. My other cat, who is not overweight, hasn't lost any weight and is still the same. I was worried having to eat a piece at a time would affect her already healthy weight, so this makes me happy. I'm so happy I found this product because before I could literally hear my cat scarfing down her food. This helps her with self control and I'm hoping over time she will be at a healthy weight
customer_reviews.author: JayMichelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: My cat's behavior has completely changed after using this bowl. It was recommended by my vet for 1-weight loss, and 2-behavioral issues. He has lost two lbs, and he is more calm and less agitated. I am not sure why his behavior had changed, but the vet's experience has been that it does make the cats less hyper. It took him a couple of days before he really tried it, but now my cat is a pro. It's cute to watch him. Others have mentioned that their pet's eyes were damaged, but I can't see how that would happen. It washes easily in the dishwasher. I bought two-one for upstairs, one for downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: readerrunnermom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Cat used to finish food within a minute and not satisfied. With this, they claw their meal and reduce their stomach size. Cat is left satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ID

customer_reviews.title: The space between the ridges is too large in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The space between the ridges is too large in the central part - my cat (just a regular female cat) can reach the bottom by inserting it's muzzle between them. Well, this is not a big deal. I take one star off because this feeder makes the cat drop the food on the floor all the time - it's basically the only normal way: to get from the feeder on the floor and then to eat from the floor. I wish it had two parts - the maze and a collecting circle around.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Meer

customer_reviews.title: Catch feeder for cats
customer_reviews.text: Works great, the cat has to really work at it which helps so they can't just stick there face in and swallow a bunch of food . Love it . It would be great if it was a bit heavier for bigger cats that's the only thing I would change or suggest
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Not for dainty or dumb cats.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be made for dogs. Cats tongues aren’t as prehensile so this thing doesn’t work great of your cat has a cat sized head and can’t fit it into the spaces. We tried showing her how to use her paws but she’s either too civilized or too stupid.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working fine and I think he's lost a little weight
customer_reviews.text: My cat is overweight despite having him on a diet from his vet. I bought this feeder to help slow down his eating and it seems to be working. The first time I placed his food in the dish I scattered it all around, but he didn't seem to know what to do or just wanted his old dish back because he wouldn't eat out of it. I then started placing the food towards the sides of the dish so he could get to it easier and after he got the hang of it I started scattering it all the dish again. Seems to be working fine and I think he's lost a little weight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slows down the cat vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This product was a bit larger than I expected, but it does a good job of slowing down my cat's ravenous eating. It only took a few minutes of me showing her what to do with my hand, then her paw, and she figured it out. I also have a feeder ball, which I like, but this keeps the food (and crumbs) in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Hoshinoko

customer_reviews.title: results may vary
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat tends to get super hungry, wolf down a lot of food, and vomit it up immediately. It worked for a little while, but then he figured out how to wolf down his food with this system anyway, so now it only works part of the time. That being said, if your cat isn't as tenacious or has a different issue that you're trying to correct, this system may still work. Also, it's very well made and looks cute, so I'll probably keep feeding him out of it to get my money's worth, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Lina H.

customer_reviews.title: Very amusing
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat has been obsessing over this for nearly a day now and he hasn't figured out yet that he's supposed to stick his feet in there and not his face (he has other food also so he isn't going hungry). I guess he's about as smart as I always thought he was ;) It's very amusing for me to watch though, and I'm sure he'll figure it out eventually. The feeder thing itself is nicer quality than expected, and has enough weight to it that it hasn't gone flying.
customer_reviews.author: mms

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend. He is able to push this around the ...
customer_reviews.text: This has absolutely helped my fatty fat tubster cat slow down from eating too much and I swear he's already lost his extra weight from having this product the last couple months. I highly recommend. He is able to push this around the kitchen tile easily. I even bought a rubberized mat to put this on and because its just plastic on the bottom he's still able to push it off the mat and around the kitchen. It does exactly what I wanted though so I'm so glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: this is one of the best purchases I have made for her
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely adores this thing. When we put it out, she was hesitant, but once she smelled her food on it, she laid next to it batting at her food for over an hour. I have to say, this is one of the best purchases I have made for her. I think it really helps keep her occupied throughout the day, and it's definitely entertaining for us!
customer_reviews.author: DelaneyTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Elegant Solution for Frenzied Eaters.
customer_reviews.text: Nacho came from the shelter and somewhere in his early life, he learned that food should be eaten immediately and totally. Leaving food out for him to graze on is not an option. We got the interactive feeder to see if we could slow his eating down and calm the whole eating process. It has done well. He uses his paws to lift pieces out and tends to eat one at a time. His eating time had moved from 2 minutes to 15 or 20. Is that better for him? We don't know, but it seems to make his meals less of a frenzy and keeps him occupied with a project a couple of times per day.
customer_reviews.author: colonelchuck

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Really Works!  Cat Likes It!
customer_reviews.text: Totally cool idea, and it really works! It makes a game of giving your cat treats (we use it with Friskies treats). I actually was dubious, but our cat really does work it! I have also heard of people using this for their cat's regular kibble, so that they don't eat as quickly (fast eating can be one cause of cats throwing up undigested food). I will say that this thing is big (and I'm talking about the pink mini) - it's easily the size of a sandwhich plate or small dinner plate, so make sure that where you plan to put it works with those dimensions (a bit over 10" by 9").
customer_reviews.author: Anne P. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend putting it on a rubber mat to help hold ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cat uses this every day for half of her dry food. It really slows her down! However, I stepped on it with bare feet (and subsequently fell) when she had scooted it into the middle of the kitchen. This thing is not flexible at all - OUCH! I highly recommend putting it on a rubber mat to help hold in place. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase (but not quite sure my cat likes it) LOL
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Totally cool product though
customer_reviews.text: Item is totally as expected. I have 3 kitties. One skiddish food whore, one fat lazy bastard and one bipolar demon child (and they're awesome). The skiddish kitteh sometimes paws the snackees out of this, the demon child is entertained by it but he's entertained by a string bean and the fat lazy one...well, he's still fat and lazy and waits for one of the others to knock a snack out then steals it. Totally cool product though. I'd say if your kitty is easily entertained then they'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Martian

customer_reviews.title: Great to help dieting kitties.
customer_reviews.text: I put my fat cat on a diet (vet's orders). I feed him his meals in a regular dish, but if he cries for more food, I sprinkle a little in here. He can't gobble it instantly and has to work to get the food out, but knowing that he has food available calms him down so he doesn't follow me around begging for more. I've also read articles saying cats who do puzzles are happier, because cats are meant to hunt. I think my cat is happier since getting this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Erin J. Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm with our fat cat
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this feeder for our cat because he's very fat and lazy. It was a real challenge for him, because he couldn't realize how to eat from there. He wasn't very happy and kept screaming asking for food. After three days he used to eat from the feeder. It does prolong eating time and now he is eating less and loosing weight. Does it make him happier? Nope)) but is definitely makes him healthier. I highly recommend this feeder for the owners of overweight pets.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn’t know what to make of it.
customer_reviews.text: We got this to slow down one of our cat’s eating. It may work too well for this purpose. We ended up getting a more traditional slow feeding bowl so that our less gluttonous pet could also get enough to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Massimo Potenza

customer_reviews.title: I'd still like to use this for something
customer_reviews.text: It was entertaining watching the cats figure this out (one of them gave up and walked away within minutes), and for a while it seemed to work in terms of slowing down their eating process. The only downside to this was ANTS. This attracted tiny ants, seemingly from nowhere, which became a huge problem. We tried washing the bowl/platter, and yet the ants came back. We've since shelved this slow-feeder, and bid farewell to the ant problem. I'd still like to use this for something, but may have to do so for treats instead of full meals. Or second-hand gift it to someone who lives in Antarctica.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: My cat doesn't throw up anymore!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to literally DRINK her dry food. She'd eat so fast that she threw up right after and beg for more food. After she started using it, she is now chewing every single pebbles and her meal time is now 30+ minutes. Compare to 1~2 minutes for same amount of dry food, that's totally life changing! She has not threw up ever since. I took one star out because the tray is moving around when she tries to grab food. Still, it was a great purchase that's so worth it. I would totally buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauranyc

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats that eat to fast
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my cat. He was eating way to fast and would throw up after. Since using it he hasn't had any issues. I was expecting it to be rubber, but its hard plastic. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that it doesn't have grips on the bottom, so it moves around on the floor when my cat uses it. I place it between the wall and his water bowl to try to prevent movement.
customer_reviews.author: I. Dorrington

customer_reviews.title: Best Slow Feeder
customer_reviews.text: My fat cat isn’t so chunky anymore. Instead of gulping down her food within minutes she’ll easily take an hour and a half on average nowadays with this cool gadget. It’s a fun little toy for both of my cats. They dig out the pebbles and eat it one by one. I can actually hear them chewing. It makes me so happy. Lol I’m very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really slowed down a trio of gulpers that would scarf ...
customer_reviews.text: Really slowed down a trio of gulpers that would scarf kibble for a minute and then go barf it up elseware. They never finished all of the food, so it wasn't a hunger issue and every one had their own bowl and enough space that it shouldn't have been a problem. Now they all share one bowl and pick out food in a much calmer manner. Nobody is barfing, and there are (surprisingly) no squabbles around the dish. Side benefit, they are eating less and the two chunky cats are loosing a bit of weight.
customer_reviews.author: DWolvin

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to gobble down all her food at once - now she has something to nibble all day long. After a few days of half-heartedly trying to get the food, she realized that was her only food, and she accepted it just fine. She was a bit overweight, and the few days with little food (by her choice), didn't cause any problems. She never complained, and acted normal in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: She hated it at first because she's used to eating out ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a try because my cat likes to eat constantly and I figured she could use the stimulation it says it provides. She hated it at first because she's used to eating out of a dish. She used it right away and seems to be used it now. She's definitely lost some weight which is my main goal for buying this. And because of the weight loss, she seems to have much more energy and runs around my place a lot more now. She is much more interested in playing with toys and playing in general. Overall she seems to be a lot better. I would definitely recommend this to someone worried about their pet's weight.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: but everything has gone fine since she figured out (with the help of treats) ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my cat had a tendency to eat too quickly and then throw up, and she hasn't done that at all since I purchased this. I've also noticed that she doesn't beg for food as often anymore. It took her a while to figure it out, but everything has gone fine since she figured out (with the help of treats) how to use it. It's kind of fun to watch her paw the food out from between the spikes (which aren't sharp at all and don't pose any danger to your cat's eyes!), like she's hunting for it
customer_reviews.author: SCNeidhardt

customer_reviews.title: my cat had terrible problems with throwing up from eating to fast
customer_reviews.text: It works, my cat had terrible problems with throwing up from eating to fast. She doesnt chew her food very well and swallows whole most of her food. This eliminated that problem almost entirely. It took about 1 week before she took to it completely. The only reason i give it 4 stars is that on a non carpeted floor, it sips around as the cat digs out the food. Rubberized bottom would make more sense but perhaps that is how it is designed. But i find it sometimes as far as 6 feet from where it normally is from cat moving it to and fro. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: D. lahoz

customer_reviews.title: Good, but doesn't work for my cat because it's solid
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but actually difficult In practice. My cat never really tried to get the food because the bristles are solid, I had thought they were flexible so figured my cat could brush around and "dig" for the food, but rather it's solid so she has to knock it off the product onto the floor to eat. In the end, she wouldn't use it and now it sits in a corner with a bunch of old cat food in it.
customer_reviews.author: J.P Poorman

customer_reviews.title: The Allure goes away quickly
customer_reviews.text: Once your cat figures it out, it does not really do as good as a job. Pros: My cat has slowed down her eating. Very easy to clean. Small so I can be placed nearby or underneath your cat's tree. Cons: Cat figures it out really quick. My cat has started to ignore her treat maze. It isn't made too be the only means of feeding your cat. I think if you get this product, you will have to buy different mazes to entertain your cat. You could instead use this maze once a week, and use other mazes or feeder mechanisms to keep your cat engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy dish for those wishing for their pets to eat slower and gain mental stimulation
customer_reviews.text: I thought my cat would fuss with this, but to my surprise, he got the hang of it immediately. He has slowed down his eating and has not thrown up since. Although, now I see him grasping the concept so well, he seems to have mastered it and he is eating a little faster again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive feeder that slows your cats down and gets their brain to work
customer_reviews.text: We use this for part of our cats' meals to slow them down so they don't eat too fast and get sick. It works pretty well as they have to stick their paws in and fish the kibbles out. It definitely slows them down and sometimes there is food left over even hours later. I read an article saying that cats like their food to be interactive so this definitely helps with that as well.
customer_reviews.author: GreenCS

customer_reviews.title: Know your cat's behavior before you buy this
customer_reviews.text: So, despite having two very curious and very hungry cats, they are unable to figure out how to use this feeder. They will circle it, meow at it, lay down next to it but will NOT pull the food out with their paws. *face palm* I bought two, one for each cat since we feed them separately. It's been 10 days. Not sure they are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: T in North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: I think this works great to deter my cats from gobbling their food
customer_reviews.text: I think this works great to deter my cats from gobbling their food, my only complaint as that it seems to be too wide so that they can't reach the center of the bowl to get out the pieces in the middle. Whenever they come hounding me for more food I can see they've gotten all of it out around the perimeter but not the middle so now I've just learned to put it around the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Colbeth

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing...my cats however were not happy. They were used to being fed on demand, just getting their food out of an always full bowl! Ha, now they have to work for it. And, after 3 or 4 days of not eating much, they've got the hang of it and I took away their food bowls except when I give them canned. One trick I did learn is don't put too much food in it, that makes it harder for them to get it out. Bonus, my oldest cat Bob has lost a little weight, and I think Ana has slimmed a bit too!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both of my cats like to eat throughout the day
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats like to eat throughout the day, and neither is terribly inclined to overeat, but one of them was gaining a little weight. My vet suggested only putting out food for a limited time, but I was concerned about the stress of changing the availability of food, so I decided to try this instead. It's worked like a charm, and now, bonus, I don't have cat food all over the floor near the dish because they eat what they extract immediately. Nobody is going hungry but the bored eating seems to have stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Helen B

customer_reviews.title: Good way to slow down a cat with an over ambitious appetite.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was eating way too fast and appeared to be 'bored'. This slows her down. I give her an 1/8 cup of dry and drop the other 1/8 cup in this feeder. At first she was "I don't know how to get to the food", I played along and showed her how it 'works'. She's not poking her eye, she has lids and lashes and can avoid hurting herself. It does the trick, no more eat/vomit cycle (sorry but that's what she'd do). This allows her to 'play' with her food a bit and if she's not hungry she will walk away.
customer_reviews.author: Mettawa Man

customer_reviews.title: Its bigger than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect...he was a little annoyed he had to work...but he is greedy and quickly accepted the task... like me and crab legs!! He eats less because he doesn't want to dig out the food for an extended period and of course he eats slower.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cat diet device!
customer_reviews.text: This really works to slow down eating and stop "bored eating". When we adopted a severely obese cat (it's a long story) we bought this to help him "diet" & it worked - Ollie lost 8 lbs and is now 14 lbs. Ollie gets 2 can of fancy feast a day plus we leave out crunches all day. Before this, he would eat all the crunchies, but now he just eats a few and goes and does something else. Moreover - since he can get to the crunchies he doesn't meow at us. This is the perfect cat diet device.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Slows down my cat from eating too fast.
customer_reviews.text: Slows down my cat from eating too fast. What would take him less than five minutes, now takes him at least 15 minutes. Before this dish, he would regularly "scarf and barf" and create messes on the carpeting. Since I got him this dish, no more barfing. I use moistened cat kibble, measured 1/3 cup dry before adding water, and spread it around. He uses his paws to fish out the food. Now it's been over a year and still using it. Still no more barfing. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Please keep in mind, this product is used by ...
customer_reviews.text: Please keep in mind, this product is used by cats. For my cat(and keep in mind each cat is different) this doesn't slow down my cat. My cat uses his paw and drags out the food kibble, and then eats it fast, or he tips it over. But in all reality, we are writing a review about a product we do not use, our cats do! For my cat, it doesn't work. He is smarter that the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: DanielM.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat interaction but hurts like no other when ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for cat interaction but hurts like no other when you step on it...😭... ... I hope you don't step on it. Ps ... one of my cats would only go after the treats in this when she thought I wasn't paying attention. Also, I can see where cats with bigger paws may not be able to manuever to get the treats out of here ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Great for slowing the overeaters....
customer_reviews.text: This is great. for a multi cat household. It's challenging enough to slow their eating. We use this, along with a "Trixie 5-in-1 Activity Center" and a "Catit Senses 2.0 Food Tree". The combination of the 3 different feeder types has helped keep our cats mentally active, enabled/promoted weight-loss and prevented fast gorging/vomiting issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie's kid

customer_reviews.title: Great for average size cats, decent for huge ones.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product and really helped us while our child was at the hospital since our cat will eat whatever we give him until he pukes. This slowed him down enough that he never had this issue even when pouring in a days worth of food. He's quite large (19 lbs) with huge paws though so I found he had trouble getting to the food in the middle. Wouldn't see this being an issue for moot normal sized cats though
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated our aging cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't see well so he gets the food from the very outside and then is frustrated. We bought this to alleviate boredom but it didn't work for our sweet fella.
customer_reviews.author: EFirst

customer_reviews.title: A Healthy Solution
customer_reviews.text: It has really helped my cat to control his eating. He has slowed down and slimmed down a bit. Improvement could be made to the bottom, to help keep it in place, as it moves around the floor. Over all, a winner!
customer_reviews.author: N. Ort

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cat busy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is addicted to Temptations. With this, she has to work for them, and gets exercise in the process. The first was a gift, and prompted me to buy another for my fosters. Love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Tigger

customer_reviews.title: My cat took awhile to learn to use it. ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat took awhile to learn to use it. I finally put the treats near the edge and that worked. Then I put them farther in toward the center. Now she has the hang of it and loves it. I found that I can even put a different brand of dry cat food in it, instead of the more expensive treats, and she still thinks she is getting a treat! (It helps that I sometimes mix in the real thing.)
customer_reviews.author: Happy Tutor

customer_reviews.title: Your solution of a fast eating cat
customer_reviews.text: As weird as this sounds, I love watching my cat work for his food. It relaxes me when I see him trying to use his paw for the food instead of shoving it down within a minute. My cat ate waaaayyyyy too fast and I had needed a solution. So I bought this and now my cat has to take his time to paw each kibble upwards and outwards in order to eat it. He didn't have too much trouble figuring it out and doesn't even mind it since he is so food driven. Also helped with his boredom.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: Works, though may take a little bit
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to get my cat to lose weight, we've been giving her a bit less to eat. Unfortunately, this sometimes that is not enough and she bugs us for more food. Then we started using this for that "little bit extra" (dry food) and that seems to have helped a lot in leaving us alone - she eventually learned to go there to look for food first. But it did take some time for her to figure this out. I think it helped that I put toys on it first (after she just looked at it - with food - like "what?").
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: Works, but its messy
customer_reviews.text: It does stop our two cats from eating too quickly. It has definitely helped them slow down and they havent been sick nearly as much. But the bottom is smooth so it slides all over our tiled floor and it makes a mess. There are constantly crumbs and stray food pieces everywhere. We just bought a tray to sit it in to catch the bits that the cats leave behind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Our Four Kitties Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Much like humans enjoy the frustrating fun of a good board game or puzzle, your feline friends will enjoy this. We dropped treats in the middle and let our four kitties have fun trying to beat each other at getting the treats out first. It was quite hilarious watching them try!
customer_reviews.author: T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I Liked it, but my cat didn't!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but just didn't work for my cat. I had to keep moving the kibbles from the inside area to the outside edge which really defeated the purpose. She hated it, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Took a little while for my 5-year old hefty Bengal kitty to accept a substitute for a bowl of easy to scarf crunchy bits, but now he seems to really enjoy working a bit for his food. First week I showed him with a finger how to dig the chow out, and he eventually got patient doing it himself. Best of all he's not following me around meowing for more food all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

product_meta.title: The Company of Animals CATCH Interactive Feeder, Purple
product_meta.description: Catch is a revolutionary way to turn a cat’s mealtime into a challenging game. Many cats lack mental stimulation, which can lead to boredom and destructive behavior. Catch prolongs eating time significantly, and this results in a happier, healthier cat that can enjoy its daily mealtimes. The simple design allows for the owner to simple scatter the desired amount of wet or dry food across the feeder. The cat can then use its paws to push or grab the food from between the smoothly rounded spikes to eat.
feature_bullets: REVOLUTIONARY way to turn a cat’'s meal into a challenging, time-consuming game
ALLEVIATES BOREDOM and results in a happier, healthier cat
STIMULATES a cat's natural instinct and helps turn feed-time into an inspiring hunting game
SLOWING DOWN EATING is important for overweight cats or those prone to gulping and digestive problems
DISHWASHER SAFE and suited for wet and dry cat foods
Age range description: All Life Stages

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
